title: Is space dust dangerous when flying in a space shuttle? - Quora

response.answer_text: Long term, yes. But while the space shuttles were in operation, they were never long enough in space to allow the small but continual damage caused be dust to be a serious problem. It had maintenance every time after it landed, including checking out the outside surface for damage, and replacing the damaged tiles if needed. The only serious threat and damage by small objects were by things bigger than dust. Chips of paint slightly bigger than grains of sand did damage windows of the Shuttles at times.
